info.title: MailChimp
info.description: MailChimp is a SaaS service that allows businesses to manage and automate email marketing activities, including sending marketing emails, automated messages and targeted campaigns.

post.description: Create a new campaign based on a Campaign Type, Recipients list and Campaign Settings (subject line, title, from_name and reply_to)

parameters.description: Ignores duplicates sent in the request

NewCampaignRequest.description: Body parameters to create a new campaign

type.description: There are four types of campaigns you can create in MailChimp. A/B Split campaigns have been deprecated and variate campaigns should be used instead. Possible Values: regular, plaintext, absplit, rss, variate

subject_line.description: The subject line for the campaign

from_name.description: The 'from' name on the campaign (not an email address)

reply_to.description: The reply-to email address for the campaign

use_conversation.description: Use MailChimp Conversation feature to manage out-of-office replies

to_name.description: The campaign's custom 'To' name. Typically the first name merge field

folder_id.description: If the campaign is listed in a folder, the id for that folder

authenticate.description: Whether MailChimp authenticated the campaign. Defaults to true

auto_footer.description: Automatically append MailChimp's default footer to the campaign

inline_css.description: Automatically inline the CSS included with the campaign content

auto_tweet.description: Automatically tweet a link to the campaign archive page when the campaign is sent

auto_fb_post.description: An array of Facebook page ids to auto-post to

fb_comments.description: Allows Facebook comments on the campaign (also force-enables the Campaign Archive toolbar). Defaults to true

winner_criteria.description: The combination that performs the best. This may be determined automatically by click rate, open rate, or total revenueâ€”or you may choose manually based on the reporting data you find the most valuable. For Multivariate Campaigns testing send_time, winner_critera is ignored. For Multivariate Campaigns with 'manual' as the winner_citeria, the winner must be chosen in the MailChimp web application

wait_time.description: The number of minutes to wait before choosing the winning campaign. The value of wait_time must be greater than 0 and in whole hours, specified in minutes

test_size.description: The percentage of recipients to send the test combinations to, must be a value between 10 and 100

subject_lines.description: The possible subject lines to test. If no subject lines are provided, settings.subject_line will be used

send_times.description: The possible send times to test. The times provided should be in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. If send_times are provided to test, the test_size will be set to 100% and winner_criteria will be ignored

from_names.description: The possible from names. The number of from_names provided must match the number of reply_to_addresses. If no from_names are provided, settings.from_name will be used

reply_to_addresses.description: The possible from names. The number of from_names provided must match the number of reply_to_addresses. If no from_names are provided, settings.from_name will be used

opens.description: Whether to track opens. Defaults to true. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns

html_clicks.description: Whether to track clicks in the HTML version of the campaign. Defaults to true. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns

text_clicks.description: Whether to track clicks in the plain-text version of the campaign. Defaults to true. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns

google_analytics.description: The custom slug for Google Analytics tracking (max of 50 bytes)

clicktale.description: The custom slug for ClickTale tracking (max of 50 bytes)

feed_url.description: The URL for the RSS feed

frequency.description: The frequency of the RSS Campaign

constrain_rss_img.description: Whether to add CSS to images in the RSS feed to constrain their width in campaigns

image_url.description: The url for the header image for the card

description.description: A short summary of the campaign to display

title.description: The title for the card. Typically the subject line of the campaign

Segment_Opts.description: An object representing all segmentation options

saved_segment_id.description: The id for an existing saved segment

match.description: Segment match type: Possible Values: any, all

Salesforce.description: Salesforce tracking options for a campaign. Must be using MailChimpâ€™s built-in Salesforce integration

campaign.description: Create a campaign in a connected Salesforce account

notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on subscriber email addresses

Highrise.description: Highrise tracking options for a campaign. Must be using MailChimpâ€™s built-in Highrise integration

campaign.description: Create a campaign in a connected Highrise account

notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on subscriber email addresses

Capsule.description: Capsule tracking options for a campaign. Must be using MailChimpâ€™s built-in Capsule integration

notes.description: Update contact notes for a campaign based on subscriber email addresses

Schedule.description: The schedule for sending the RSS Campaign

hour.description: The hour to send the campaign in local time. Acceptable hours are 0-23. For example, â€˜4â€™ would be 4am in your accountâ€™s default time zone

weekly_send_day.description: The day of the week to send a weekly RSS Campaign

monthly_send_date.description: The day of the month to send a monthly RSS Campaign. Acceptable days are 1-32, where â€˜0â€™ is always the last day of a month. Months with fewer than the selected number of days will not have an RSS campaign sent out that day. For example, RSS Campaigns set to send on the 30th will not go out in February

Daily_Send.description: The days of the week to send a daily RSS Campaign.

sunday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Sundays

monday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Mondays

tuesday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Tuesdays

wednesday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Wednesdays

thursday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Thursdays

friday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Fridays

saturday.description: Sends the daily RSS Campaign on Saturdays

id.description: A string that uniquely identifies this campaign

type.description: There are four types of campaigns you can create in MailChimp. A/B Split campaigns have been deprecated and variate campaigns should be used instead

create_time.description: The date and time the campaign was created

archive_url.description: The link to the campaignâ€™s archive version

status.description: The link to the campaignâ€™s archive version

emails_sent.description: The total number of emails sent for this campaign

send_time.description: The time and date a campaign was sent

content_type.description: How the campaignâ€™s content is put together (â€˜templateâ€™, â€˜drag_and_dropâ€™, â€˜htmlâ€™, â€˜urlâ€™)

_links.description: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents

subject_line.description: The subject line for the campaign

from_name.description: The 'from' name on the campaign (not an email address)

reply_to.description: The reply-to email address for the campaign

use_conversation.description: Use MailChimp Conversation feature to manage out-of-office replies

to_name.description: The campaign's custom 'To' name. Typically the first name merge field

folder_id.description: If the campaign is listed in a folder, the id for that folder

authenticate.description: Whether MailChimp authenticated the campaign. Defaults to true

auto_footer.description: Automatically append MailChimp's default footer to the campaign

inline_css.description: Automatically inline the CSS included with the campaign content

auto_tweet.description: Automatically tweet a link to the campaign archive page when the campaign is sent

auto_fb_post.description: An array of Facebook page ids to auto-post to

fb_comments.description: Allows Facebook comments on the campaign (also force-enables the Campaign Archive toolbar). Defaults to true

AB_Split_Opts.description: A/B Testing options for a campaign

split_test.description: The type of AB split to run

pick_winner.description: How we should evaluate a winner. Based on 'opens', 'clicks', or 'manual'

wait_units.description: How unit of time for measuring the winner ('hours' or 'days'). This cannot be changed after a campaign is sent

wait_time.description: The amount of time to wait before picking a winner. This cannot be changed after a campaign is sent

split_size.description: The size of the split groups. Campaigns split based on 'schedule' are forced to have a 50/50 split. Valid split integers are between 1-50

from_name_a.description: For campaigns split on 'From Name', the name for Group A

from_name_b.description: For campaigns split on 'From Name', the name for Group B

reply_email_a.description: For campaigns split on â€˜From Nameâ€™, the reply-to address for Group A

reply_email_b.description: For campaigns split on â€˜From Nameâ€™, the reply-to address for Group B

subject_a.description: For campaigns split on â€˜Subject Lineâ€™, the subject line for Group A

subject_b.description: For campaigns split on â€˜Subject Lineâ€™, the subject line for Group B

send_time_a.description: The send time for Group A

send_time_b.description: The send time for Group B

send_time_winner.description: The send time for the winning version

Report_Summary.description: For sent campaigns, a summary of opens, clicks, and unsubscribes

opens.description: The total number of opens for a campaign

open_rate.description: The number of unique opens divided by the total number of successful deliveries

clicks.description: The total number of clicks for an campaign

click_rate.description: The number of unique clicks divided by the total number of successful deliveries

Delivery_Status.description: Updates on campaigns in the process of sending

enabled.description: Whether Campaign Delivery Status is enabled for this account and campaign

can_cancel.description: Whether a campaign send can be canceled

status.description: The current state of a campaign delivery

emails_sent.description: The total number of emails confirmed sent for this campaign so far

emails_canceled.description: The total number of emails canceled for this campaign

Link.description: Capsule tracking options for a campaign. Must be using MailChimpâ€™s built-in Capsule integration

rel.description: As with an HTML â€˜relâ€™ attribute, this describes the type of link

href.description: This property contains a fully-qualified URL that can be called to retrieve the linked resource or perform the linked action

method.description: The HTTP method that should be used when accessing the URL defined in â€˜hrefâ€™. (GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, OPTIONS, HEAD)

targetSchema.description: For GETs, this is a URL representing the schema that the response should conform to

schema.description: For HTTP methods that can receive bodies (POST and PUT), this is a URL representing the schema that the body should conform to

NewCampaignRequestV2.description: Body parameters to create a new campaign (V2)

type.description: There are four types of campaigns you can create in MailChimp. A/B Split campaigns have been deprecated and variate campaigns should be used instead. Possible Values: regular, plaintext, absplit, rss, variate

NewListRequest.description: Body parameters to create a new campaign

permission_reminder.description: Text to remind people how they signed up to this list

use_archive_bar.description: Whether campaigns for this list use the Archive Bar in archives by default

notify_on_subscribe.description: The email address to send subscribe notifications to

notify_on_unsubscribe.description: The email address to send unsubscribe notifications to

email_type_option.description: When set to true, subscribers can choose whether they want to receive HTML or plain-text emails. When set to false, subscribers will receive HTML emails, with a plain-text alternative backup
email_type_option.x-ms-summary: Allow users to choose between HTML and Plain text (true/false)?

visibility.description: Whether this list is public or private

Contact.description: Capsule tracking options for a campaign. Must be using MailChimpâ€™s built-in Capsule integration

company.description: The company name for the list

address1.description: The street address for the list contact

address2.description: The street address for the list contact

city.description: The city for the list contact

state.description: The state for the list contact

zip.description: The postal or zip code for the list contact

country.description: A two-character ISO3166 country code. Defaults to US if invalid

phone.description: The phone number for the list contact

Campaign_Defaults.description: Capsule tracking options for a campaign. Must be using MailChimpâ€™s built-in Capsule integration

from_name.description: The default from name for campaigns sent to this list

from_email.description: The default from email for campaigns sent to this list

subject.description: The default subject line for campaigns sent to this list

language.description: The default language for this listsâ€™s forms

id.description: A string that uniquely identifies this list

permission_reminder.description: The permission reminder for the list

use_archive_bar.description: Whether campaigns for this list use the Archive Bar in archives by default

notify_on_subscribe.description: The email address to send subscribe notifications to

notify_on_unsubscribe.description: The email address to send unsubscribe notifications to

date_created.description: The date and time that this list was created

list_rating.description: An auto-generated activity score for the list (0-5)

email_type_option.description: Whether the list supports multiple formats for emails.When set to true, subscribers can choose whether they want to receive HTML or plain-text emails.When set to false, subscribers will receive HTML emails, with a plain-text alternative backup

subscribe_url_short.description: Our EepURL shortened version of this listâ€™s subscribe form

subscribe_url_long.description: The full version of this listâ€™s subscribe form (host will vary)

visibility.description: Whether this list is public or private

modules.description: Any list-specific modules installed for this list

_links.description: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents

Stats.description: Stats for the list. Many of these are cached for at least five minutes

member_count.description: The number of active members in the list

unsubscribe_count.description: The number of members who have unsubscribed from the list

cleaned_count.description: The number of members cleaned from the list

member_count_since_send.description: The number of active members in the list since the last campaign was sent

unsubscribe_count_since_send.description: The number of members who have unsubscribed since the last campaign was sent

cleaned_count_since_send.description: The number of members cleaned from the list since the last campaign was sent

campaign_count.description: The number of campaigns in any status that use this list

campaign_last_sent.description: The date and time the last campaign was sent to this list

merge_field_count.description: The number of merge vars for this list (not EMAIL, which is required)

avg_sub_rate.description: The average number of subscriptions per month for the list(not returned if we havenâ€™t calculated it yet)

avg_unsub_rate.description: The average number of unsubscriptions per month for the list(not returned if we havenâ€™t calculated it yet)

target_sub_rate.description: The target number of subscriptions per month for the list to keep it growing(not returned if we havenâ€™t calculated it yet)

open_rate.description: The average open rate(a percentage represented as a number between 0 and 100) per campaign for the list(not returned if we havenâ€™t calculated it yet)

click_rate.description: The average click rate(a percentage represented as a number between 0 and 100) per campaign for the list(not returned if we havenâ€™t calculated it yet)

last_sub_date.description: The date and time of the last time someone subscribed to this list

last_unsub_date.description: The date and time of the last time someone unsubscribed from this list

lists.description: An array of objects, each representing a list

total_items.description: The total number of items matching the query regardless of pagination

members.title: List Members
members.description: An array of objects, each representing an email address and the subscription status for a specific list. Up to 500 members may be added or updated with each API call.

update_existing.title: Update Existing Members
update_existing.description: Whether this batch operation will change existing members' subscription status.

NewMemberInListRequest.description: Add a new member to the list

email_type.description: Type of email this member asked to get (â€˜htmlâ€™ or â€˜textâ€™)

status.description: Subscriberâ€™s current status. Possible Values: subscribed, unsubscribed, cleaned, pending

FirstAndLastName.description: Merged fields containing User First name and last name

id.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list memberâ€™s email address

unique_email_id.description: An identifier for the address across all of MailChimp

email_type.description: Type of email this member asked to get (â€˜htmlâ€™ or â€˜textâ€™).

status.description: Subscriberâ€™s current status. Possible Values: subscribed, unsubscribed, cleaned, pending

ip_signup.description: IP address the subscriber signed up from

timestamp_signup.description: Date and time the subscriber signed up for the list

ip_opt.description: The IP address the subscriber used to confirm their opt-in status

timestamp_opt.description: Date and time the subscribe confirmed their opt-in status

member_rating.description: Star rating for this member, between 1 and 5

last_changed.description: Date and time the memberâ€™s info was last changed

_links.description: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents

Last_Note.description: THe most recent Note added about this member

created_at.description: The date the note was created

GetAddMembersBatchResponseModel.description: Response when subscribing or unsubscribing list members in a batch

total_created.description: Total number of members that were added to the list

total_updated.description: The total number of an existing list members whose subscription status was updated

error_count.description: The number email addresses that could not be added to the list or updated

GetAllMembersResponseModel.description: Response when querying for all members in a list

members.description: An array of objects, each representing a specific list member

total_items.description: The total number of items matching the query regardless of pagination

status.description: Subscriberâ€™s current status. Possible Values: subscribed, unsubscribed, cleaned, pending

email_type.description: Type of email this member asked to get (â€˜htmlâ€™ or â€˜textâ€™).

status.description: Subscriberâ€™s current status. Possible Values: subscribed, unsubscribed, cleaned, pending

ip_signup.description: IP address the subscriber signed up from

timestamp_signup.description: Date and time the subscriber signed up for the list

ip_opt.description: The IP address the subscriber used to confirm their opt-in status
